comment:
Hello,

researching briefly the connected people you listed this is what we found:
John George Bestman born in 1939 (Liberian)
Currently Board Member of Central Bank of Liberia
Director at African Gulf Plc (U.K.) from 2007 until 2009 when it was dissolved. It did not have any subsidiaries.
At that time directors were also:
Anthony Illingworth, Andrew James Cecil, Samuel Polypheus Jackson

Anthony Illingworth born in 1938 was a secretary (or director) in 11 other British companies involved in environmental and energy business, some of them with Liberia in the name of the company:
Resourcefin Strategies International Ltd, Commonwealth Gold Plc, Global Environmental Technologies Plc, Global Equilibrium Ltd, Global Environmental Management Systems Ltd, International Resource and Energy Corporation of Liberia Plc, African Gulf Energy Plc, Global Administrative Services Plc, International Finance Corporation of Liberia Plc, Age Oil Plc, African Gulf Plc

Andrew James Cecil born in 1944; (British) was a secretary (or director) in 11 other British companies all of which are dissolved.

Samuel Polypheus Jackson born in 1950; (British), was a director or a secretary in 7 other British companies all of which are dissolved.

In order to do more in-depth research of people we need some more information to help us identify them - we need date of birth, address any other information you have.
If you have such need please send us another request, we'll be happy to help.

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Thanks so much for this help. It was great to get the Kamina Global registration information, even if it says nothing about the owners and directors! Since making the request we have found some further information based on company registration documents in Liberia. This shines a bit more light on Subsea BV and points to a potential lead. 

The articles for registration for Liberian Forest Products Inc (LFPI) of November 2006 indicate that LFPI is a Liberian company owned by Tony Smith (50%) and A. Kanie Wesso (50%), who are both trustees for a new company to be formed, called Subsea BV. The sole LFPI director named in the document is Mark Slowen. The business registry document of August 2007, indicates that LFPI is a British owned company, 50% owned by Mark Slowen and 50% owned by Kanie Wesso (a Liberian lawyer who we assume is just a trustee for the real owners). No mention is made of Subsea BV in that document.  

Mark Slowen was also the CEO of SubSea Resources DMCC (Dubai Multi Commodities Centre), a company that acquired mineral rights in Liberia and then transferred them to another company called Ocean Botton Resources West Africa on November 26, 2008.

We attempted to contact Slowen by way of a telephone contact number found on the internet. A Liberian guy called Alex answered the phone, saying he is Mark Slowen's assistant. He said he would be meeting with Slowen in an hour and asked us to call him the next morning. Our local partner organisation then made several attempts to reach him, but he has not answered his phone. (+231 88 6454050)

Interestingly, there is a company in the UK named Subsea BV that is linked to the G4 Group of the UK. The G4 Group has several business interests in Liberia and is controlled by the notorious financial fraudster Lincoln Fraser. 

Fraser is described by Offshore Alert as a "British conman who masterminded the $400 million Imperial Consolidated fraud" which robbed thousands of pensioners and others of their savings when it went bankrupt in 2002. The Spanish and Israeli secret services suspected that Imperial Consolidated was working with global arms dealer Monzer Al Kassar to run guns to Osama Bin Laden through an Argentinian gold mining company set up by a close friend of President Carlos Menem and highly overvalued on Imperial Consolidated's books. Bankruptcy did not prevent Fraser from subsequently establishing "a complex, multi-jurisdictional web of companies plastered with red flags." A number of these Fraser controlled companies operate under his G4 Group-- "a multi-national biotechnology, bioenergy and agricultural development and solution provider". 

The G4 Group's Liberian subsidiary, G4 WAO Inc., exports rubber tree logs and holds a phosphate exploration concession covering 36,000 ha in Bopolu. According to the company website, G4 WAO “manages in excess of one million acres of the best crop growing conditions in the world” and has partnered with the International Crops Research Institute for the Semi-Arid-Tropics (ICRISAT) “to establish trial sites on various G4 farming enterprises in Liberia, Ghana and Kenya."

We have so far been unable to uncover much information about Mark Slowen, who seems to be key in uncovering who the beneficial owners of Subsea BV and Kamina Global are. If you can help us to find more information about him, including what he is currently doing in Liberia, this would be deeply appreciated.

Also, any further information about Subsea BV would also be very useful.

Thanks again!
author: ah5zfmludmVzdGlnYXRpdmUtZGFzaGJvYXJkLXByb2RyGAsSC1VzZXJQcm9maWxlGICAgICA99IIDA

comment:
Hi Devlin,

I'm sorry that this response comes wit this long overdue but I hope you'll find some information here useful.

Mark Slowen (DOB: 1958-10-12) is former director of two British companies:
Crane Engineering Ltd and Powersource (GB) Ltd
Both companies were dissolved long time ago.
If you open a free account on duedil.com you'll be able to find more information on it there.

The records I attached are from Orbis database and please don't publish them.

Directors of these two companies at the same time were:

Neil Slowen (DOB: 1963-04-02) and Jennifer Mary Slowen (DOB: 1966-11-18). They had the same registered address.

I attached all the search results about directorships and shareholders' positions from Orbis for both of them.

Subsea BV could not be located anywhere yet. I understand that it can be in an offshore zone that is not covered by any of the general databases we have access to.
I did search in the online registry of Liberia and I didn't find it.
There are many other similar variations of this name worldwide but this exact one not.

Now, there is a company called Subsea 7 S.A. and I attached a profile from Lexis for you to look at. Please check if this is the one. If it is, than you'll see that it is operated in many countries:  Luxemburg, the United Kingdom, Norway, Nigeria, Angola etc.

Wish you the best of luck with your research!

Lejla Camdzic

comment:
Hello Diana,

first of all, I hope that you'll find some of this stuff useful for your research. You can find a summary of it in the file HKND Group - Response overview.
The Cayman Island registry does not collect information on directors and shareholders, only agents have that information and it's not in their interest to disclose it of course.

As you'll see - we've found a company HK Nicaragua Canal Development Investment Co in Hong Kong and we've obtained the original records for it. In one of them you'll find Wang Jong's personal Chinese ID number and it contain's his DOB which is very useful for the future research.
However, he's no longer the owner of this company. The shares were transferred to a company that appears only to have the Chinese name. Some of our associates transliterated it for us and it should be either:
Beijing Dayang Xinhe Touzi Guanli Youxian Gongsi
or
Beijing Dayang New River Investment Management Limited (also referred to as Ocean New River in the media reports on the Ukrainian project)
Our associates also found a lot about it online in Chinese and a lot of it showed that Wang Jing is 100% owner if this company and that it was registered in September 2012. Unfortunately, we don't have the original company records for this.

Wang Jing also started a project in Ukraine in December and met with President Yanukovich. That I'm sure you found out yourself.
Media there mentioned more companies and local registry of Ukraine might reveal more. Perhaps some colleagues from Ukraine would be a good resource for you.

As far as determining where Jing got his money and if he has the expertise - that part is very difficult to document.

This is all we can offer at the moment. We've searched all the general databases we have access to and all other places that  can be searched by personal name.
If you have some new information and need help with something else, just let us know.

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Hi John,

Luminar Finance was not found as a registered company in Israel.
A company with the same name was found in India.
I am sending you an overview from Orbis and Lexis/Nexis. These are worldwide general databases and we ask you not to publish these documents because they rely on the information from information providers, not necessarily on the original company records.

Luminar finance was also found in UK. This company is going through the insolvency procedures since 2011.
It is owned by Luminar Group Holdings PLC which is an investment fund holding funds from dozens of other holding companies, banks' investment divisions etc.

Researching the list of the individuals who might be connected to the background that you described is a more complicated process and would require their dates of births, addresses, personal IDs, possible associates and connections etc.

Best,

Lejla Camdzic
Researcher

comment:
Dear Ahmed,

I realize your request is pretty old.
We did not forget about it. 
We did some research but I assume you did some work over the last few months and this info could be outdated for you.

Investigative Dashboard is a tool intended for investigative reporters who are trying to prove some wrongoings or expose corruption and organized crime activities.
We cannot do reporting an try to figure out if a story exists or not.

Al-Bukhary family empire is indeed huge and if you were trying to prove or expose some wroindoings of family members or companies that belong to this network, we would be more than willing to help, this is what our purpose is.

For this, we would expect to get a specific question or a request regarding a specific company ownership or to check if some individual owns a company somewhere.

I will close your request, but if you have some more specific question (not determining everything that belongs to a family empire) please feel free to file a separate request and we'll get to it.

The attached files are just a selection from thousands of results from the global databases that we accessed and please don't publish these as the information they contain are not official company records and they can be out of date.

Most of the companies are in Malaysia, where you are more likey to have access to information than we are.

We wish you the best of luck.

Lejla Camdzic
Researcher

comment:
Hello Mathias,

this is what I have managed to pull out so far.
I will give you an outline of the current shareholders of the companies involved, but please also go over the files and check out the previous owners, it might give you some additional information of value.

Pamtilon Holdings Ltd is owned by Specimax Co Ltd (CY)
Specimax Co Ltd is owned by: Scoremax Holdings Ltd (CY) 94,29% and Mountaindrop Co Ltd (CY) 5,71%
Scoremax Holdings Ltd is owned by Eulachon Ltd (Isle of Man)
Eulachon Ltd has a proxy director company Equity Services Ltd (Isle of Man) and a subscriber Sauger Ltd (Isle of Man)

Johny Shubitidze whose name I saw in the Georgian files you shared is also one of the directors in a Czech company GC Group SRO. Other directors in this company are Konstantine Abesadze, Nato Burjanadze, Zurab Kutelia, Maia Veltauri. They are also the shareholders each holding 20% of the share capital.

Johny Shubitidze is also found in GC Trade where he holds 17% of share capital.

Elena Michael Serdobova is a director in 16 companies in Cyprus and was for one company in Sweden called Orevatten Rederi AB. 
She is also a director in Anoki Management Corp in Panama along with Nikolay Potapenko and Angeliki Englezou

comment:
Hi Dmytro,

as you can see, I'v added the registry overview and the gazette notification.
This first gazette notification will show you that when the company was registered the capital of this company was 100 bearer shares each worth 1000 CHF.

This means that whoever holds the physical certificate of the shares is the owner of the company.
The registries normally don't register the owner and do not track transfers of ownership.
There was only one registered change since and it's about the change of the auditor.

In order to research in detail Peter Pallag and Mykola Prysyazhniuk I really need more info on them. Their dates of birth, nationalities, addresses and anything else available to you.
So far, I can tell you that Peter Pallag was a director of a British company Reef Steel works Ltd with Borys Prysyazhnyuk, Dimitri Ossetrov, Oleg Belousz. This company was dissolved in 2008 but maybe it's former shareholders can give you some new info.

Mykola Prysyazhnyuk was director in a British company Reef Holdings PLC which was dissolved in 2008.
Its owner was company Palling Anstalt from Liechtenstein.
The directors were also Borys Prysyazhnyuk, Oleg Belousz, Alexandre Kravtsov.

Borys Prysyazhnyuk appears also in Hungary I believe.

If you need more info, please file a new request.

Thank you.

Best, 

Lejla

comment:
Hello,

we have looked at your request and did some preliminary research. Attached you will find credible lists of companies where name Oliver Heller appears. However, it would take a more in-depth research to determine his real identity according to his date of birth.

This is a link for the Swiss registry where you have basic company information available for free:
http://zefix.ch/zfx-cgi/hrform.cgi/hraPage?alle_eintr=on&pers_sort=original&pers_num=0&language=4&col_width=366&amt=007

And this is a link for the German registry where you can look up all of the companies where this name appears and obtain detailed records:
https://www.unternehmensregister.de/ureg/?submitaction=language&language=en

Your profile did not give us enough information to conclude whether you are a journalist, or which organization you belong to. This is neccessary so that we can decide if the research is subsidized or not.
If you can, please update your profile, look at the information provided so far and let us know if we can help you in some other way.

Regards,

Lejla Camdzic
Researcher

Dear Mathias,

we did not manage to locate Rich Metals Group in Russia, only in Netherlands.
About Rich Metals Group B.V. from Netherlands:
on 14 June 2012 all shares of the Company were sold to a third party and the Company became a joint venture of two companies:
Mineral Resources Management LLC, Georgia and Mining Developments- Georgia LLC, Georgia.
Its former name is GPM Georgia B.V.
All this information is available in the Annual Report of 2011.

I did other research but please note that you are NOT allowed to publish these Orbis company profiles attached here . This is just a reference for you.
Also, it is essential that you check the full name and as much personal information of Korzhev and Troitski to be able to confirm that  we indeed found the right person.

I found Troitckii and Korzhev  in Russia as Board directors in company O'Key together with Kera Kheigo and Boris Volchek (Orbis file attached).
This company is owned by O'Key S.A. - company from Luxembourg and the same people appear in this company too.

Dmitri Korzhev also appears as a director in:
Sovmestnyi Kapital in Russia which is owned by Yurii Ivanovich Pilipenko
Regionalnyi Inzhenernyi Servisnyi Tsentr (RITS) in Russia - dissolved in 2012
Rubus Idaeus S.L. - a dormant company in Spain owned by Garcia Gomez Bernanda
Ruskii Sok - a dissolved company in Russia

Dmitri Korzhev owns a companies Purshkinskyi Dvorik and Perspective Ltd in Russia

Dimitrii Troitsky (or Troitckii) is also a Board Member in Bank Sain-Petersburg and Sovmestnoe Predpriyatie Niko

comment:
Summary
Tamás Bela Szemerey is shareholder in 2 companies in Slovakia and in 13 companies in Hungary (see list attached). I am assuming you have already checked him in the Hungarian registry or you can check it based on the list of companies attached.
I have found a number of interesting connections of Szemerey with NY Management and with a man named Jan Nagy. You will see details below. Jan Nagy might be Hungarian according to his family name (he is born Jan. 4, 1963) - I read in the Hungarian media that he is a Hungarian-Slovak businessman so I assume it is the same person. He appears in a number of companies in Slovakia and Czech Republic together with Zuzana Nagyova/Nagy (born on Oct. 14, 1975). She might be related to Jan Nagy, if it's relevant you could check this further if you can find his family connections. Both have residency in Slovak Republic and I attached a list of their company connections in Slovakia. Jan Nagy is also director in a Slovak company PROSPEKTOR sro, which is owned by a USA-based company ANDOVER TRADING, Inc. B.F.I. Inc. from Wyoming. According to the Wyoming Registry, this company is inactive-administratively dissolved (see document). If it turns out that Jan Nagy is an interesting character for you, let me know and we can follow up on him. 
Regarding the companies and people of primary interest to you, I attached all the documentation identified until now with some summary below:

Bawaco Invest:
Vs.hu is owned by Czech company Bawaco Invest. 
Bawaco Invest is owned 100% by NY Management (See link here: http://wwwinfo.mfcr.cz/cgi-bin/ares/darv_or.cgi?ICO=29317983&odp=html&jazyk=cz&xml=1 , and company records for Bawaco Invest attached.). Its official representatives are Jan Nagy and Zuzana Nagy (or Zuzana Nagyová as it appears in Slovak and Czech registry, it is the same person). 
Jan Nagy is business associate of Szemerey Tamás Bela in two Slovak companies: REY, SPOL.S R.O. and BK-Konzult Slovakia (see details below and attached documents of the two companies). 
Zuzana Nagy appears in the Managing Board of NY Management in Slovakia (see documents attached). 
Jan Nagy appears in dozens of companies in Slovakia (see list attached and here: http://foaf.sk/ludia/56976), while Zuzana Nagy appears in several others (see list attached and link here: http://foaf.sk/ludia/88804). They are also present in Czech companies. 
Szemerey Tamás
Szemerey Tamás Bela owns shares in two companies in Slovakia: REY, SPOL.S R.O and BK-Konzult Slovakia, s.r.o.
Szemerey Tamás and NY Management a.s. own Slovakian company REY, SPOL.S R.O. (see company file: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?ID=3713&SID=7&P=1&lan=en and document attached). Managing director of the company is the same Jan Nagy (since 03/19/2003, see attached document). The network of connections of REY, SPOL.S R.O. is attached and available online here: http://foaf.sk/firmy/27259. Jan Nagy was a shareholder in this company before NY Management took over so he probably sold his shares to NY Management (see: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?ID=3713&SID=7&P=1&lan=en  and document attached).   
Szemerey Tamás Bela owns shares in BK-Konzult Slovakia, s.r.o., together with Gábor János Muskovszky and Szemerey Tamás Daniel (registry document attached and available online here: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?lan=en&ID=204787&SID=7&P=1). The network of connections of BK-Konzult Slovakia, s.r.o. is available here: http://foaf.sk/firmy/288394 (also document attached)
 Basically, the only direct link that I found until now between Szemerey Tamás Bela and NY Management is their co-ownership of REY, SPOL.S R.O. in Slovakia.
NY Management
NY Management is incorporated in Slovakia. Details of owners were not available in the online registry for this company. (see: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?ID=74857&SID=2&P=1, document attached). We will try to get original copies of documents from the office of the Slovak registry, where shareholders may show up. I will send you whatever we can find there.
In the past, Peter Radošinský, Board Member of NY Management, and the NY Management itself were shareholders in SEGA GROUP Real, s.r.o.  (see attached registry document and link here: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?lan=en&ID=181226&SID=7&P=1). Jan Nagy was also a shareholder and director in SEGA GROUP Real, s.r.o., at the same time as Peter Radošinský (see attached registry document). SEGA GROUP Real, s.r.o. is owned by Company Management s. r. o. (see: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?lan=en&ID=181226&SID=7&P=1 and document attached), which in turn, is owned by two offshore companies from Seychelles: Cossack Enterprise Corp. and CE Investment Inc. (see link: http://orsr.sk/vypis.asp?lan=en&ID=126819&SID=2&P=1 and document attached). The Managing Director of Company Management sro is Michail Martynov (registered address: Pribišova 45, Bratislava 841 05), who appears in 140 records of Slovak companies and is probably a nominee/proxy director or a company formation agent (see list of companies here: http://orsr.sk/hladaj_osoba.asp?lan=en&PR=Martynov&MENO=&SID=0&T=&STR=1 )
--------------
Let me know if you are interested in other data related to any of these people or companies, we will try to help. Hopefully we can get the NY Management shareholders from the original documents at the Registry desk.

comment:
Hi Attila,

Our colleagues from Slovakia have been searching more data for the ownership of NY Management, which seems to be a mystery still. Here is what they say now:

"here are some initial information regarding shareholders of the company NY management a.s.

Generally, according to the Slovak law joint stock companies aren’t obligated to make public their shareholders in the Business register (doesn’t apply on media or banks). They only need to do that in case if all shares are owned by one person.

Thats why we hoped maybe we could find some references to shareholders in annual financial statements of the company. Companies in Slovakia are obligated to deposit annual financial statements in the collection documents of the reponsible court. If they don’t fulfil this duty, they risk the penalty 3310 eur.

But as we found ou since 2006 there are no annual financial statments deposited by NY management in the responsible court – at least according to the Business register webpage. Ate the first sight we didn’t find any reason or any legal exception for that.

Now my colleague Rasto tries to make an appointment at the responsible court to find out wheter they really don’t have deposited any financial statements regarding NY management and what could be the reason for that. 

Once we have information from the depository court i will let you know. "

Will be back with new data if we find more.

How is your investigation going? did you publish anything new?

Best,
Laura
author: ah5zfmludmVzdGlnYXRpdmUtZGFzaGJvYXJkLXByb2RyFAsSC1VzZXJQcm9maWxlGPqljQEM

comment:
Hello, Lejla!

Thank You so much for Your help with Dashboard!

I gathered some information on these people that might be useful, listed below are DoB, possible addresses, full names and close relatives. In Ukrainian we don't have middle name but the full official name includes a derivative from a persons fathers name. In brackets I also wrote the optional spelling for names and addresses, because, as we've already noticed, registering a company abroad Ukrainian businessman do not always transliterate their names from Ukrainian as it should be, but also from Russian if they are Russian-speaking. 

I hope that might help with finding out what other businesses they are engaged with.

Thank You in advance! Best wishes, Lesya.

comment:
Hello Lejla! 

Sorry for the this mass with the company names - even the official registrar keeps writing in different ways. I found this company also written with "d" in the middle so it could be Valdhem / Waldhem or Valdhelm / Waldhelm. I guess thats the last option.


P.S.: I was wondering if Dashboard works with Netherlands and Jersey. The official Netherlands registrar does not disclose company ownership if there is more than 1 owner: we ordered the documents but  apparently there’s more than 1 owner because the docs we’ve received show all the info except for the owners. And Jersey as far as I know has the same confidentiality policy as Delaware. So I wanted to ask if Dashboard has any experience with such cases and if there’s a point in filing a request to Dashboard? Or this is a dead end? 

Thank You in advance! Lesya.

comment:
Hi, 

Please find attached response by Khadija Sharife. She did extensive research into this matter and her findings go beyond regular ID work. She is interested to work on this matter further if you are interesting in partnering with us on this investigation. 

She suggests two angles:

a) The primary nexus between Sierra Leone, Chiquita and the Sierra Rutile connection. The Africa angle contextualizes the intrinsic character of Chiquita and their desire to remain hidden in Sierra Leone in their land use and acquisition. 

b) It also draws attention to massive tax avoidance by Sierra Rutile, third largest producer of titanium in the world under TRG, run by crooks like Jean Raymond Boulle, backer of DRC and other resource-driven wars.

Best, Miranda

comment:
Hi 

If you are agreeable, we would like to collaborate on Chiquita in Sierra Leone etc, or blog about it separately, referencing you and your work. 

From wikileaks documents, corporate etc, Chiquita is working indirectly/backdoor in Sierra Leone for land use, under guise of community projects, for banana and other crops. 

Referring to Sierra Leone, Cote d'Ivoire etc, the Wikileaks cable notes:

"Chiquita made a strategic decision to invest in Africa differently than it has invested in Latin America. Specifically, the company will not invest directly in land or cultivation, but will be putting capital resources in technical assistance, innovation and marketing.  What this means practically is that Chiquita partners with a local investor who buys/leases the land and invests capital in 
infrastructure and production, while Chiquita provides significant technical assistance and purchases the resulting product."

http://www.wikileaks.org/plusd/cables/07MAPUTO1208_a.html

comment:
Please find attached documents related to directors of Lexshell 826, 827 as well as documentation related to Piruvo, Optimum Coal. Shanduka Coal, Umcebo and other related information (Piruto annual accounts for 2010 and 2011). 
The shareholders and other details for Lexshell 827 have been requested from CIPRO in South Africa which requires 5-10 working days, for processing and remittance via email. Private companies do not need to list certain types of information but we will inquire after whatever is available. 
Please find the name of a development economist at University of Kwa-Zulu Natal (Prof Patrick Bond pbond@mail.ngo.za), who has covered Ramaphosa, extensively, and can provide academic, economic and other data for assistance; and the name of the head of Benchmarks Foundation (David van Wyk d.vanwyk58@gmail.com), which has done extensive studies on coal etc. 
Notes:
Broadly, the case can be argued that Ramaphosa, a former senior politician, is facilitating a monopoly on energy in South Africa through coordination with Glencore (as Optimum deal evidence, below) via Shanduka, as well as Xstrata, where Shanduka is majority shareholder. His role is as both businessman as well as 'struggle veteran' facilitating political liberation capital that reaches high, and far. Until merger, five dominant players:  – BHP, Anglo Coal, Exxaro Resources, Xstrata, Sasol. 
Interesting op-ed in Mail & Guardian about state-corporate collusion: http://mg.co.za/article/2013-02-01-00-ramaphosa-epitomises-corporate-state-collusion
Media reports summarised (italics):
Ramaphosa's presence is seen as crucial in the ANC due to struggle history and his role as mega- black economic empowerment (BEE) corporate player. http://www.iol.co.za/news/politics/zuma-talks-tough-1.1450584#.UrmKiPRdWPU
The country's state electricity company, Eskom, withdrew intervention from the merger earlier this year, media poses, possibly due to the political currency of Ramaphosa, despite prior concerns. 
http://www.iol.co.za/business/news/eskom-retracts-glencore-xstrata-challenge-1.1455165#.Urh7efRdWPV
The entities listed are part of key deals involved in the merger between Xstrata, one of the world's largets coal mining companies, and Glencore, the world's largest publicly trading commodity house in South Africa. Valued at over 22 billion GBP (SA merger), the deal may evidence the near control of coal - used for 80% of South Africa's energy: if supply for 'tied' or domestic market is manipulated;  prices set for domestic purchase at export pricing; and domestic security vulnerable to export tonnage; buying up/forcing out, small producers.
Explanatory information from a witness re: the merger:
“the merger will add considerable critical mass to Glencore’s production activities and access to the RBCT, which will enhance its ability to influence the market in a way that is detrimental to Eskom.” – [Maharaj, 2012: para 36] 
[3.2] a reduction in the quality of coal supplied to Eskom (with resultant detrimental effects on the stability of Eskom’s generation equipment and the increased possibility of unplanned outages and load shedding); and,  
[3.3] a likely increase in the exporting of coal with the concomitant consequences for domestic prices of coal to Eskom (in order to prevent increased coal exports, Eskom would be required to match the economic return gained from exporting the relevant quality of coal by subjecting itself to export parity pricing.)” – [Maharaj, 2012: para 3] 
From: Maharaj, K. (2012) Non-confidential witness statement in the Glencore Xstrata merger case number 33/LM/Mar12 
Eskom is thinly supplied (vulnerable) and while Xstrata has supplied Eskom prior (not without problems), the core business of Glencore as a mega- trading house focused on export of resources renders this dangerous as merger would unlock international buyers for coal at export pricing parity, logically facilitating energy shortages unless a cap is signed. 
Profit maximising for grades required, example RB3 coal (re: Asian demand) would devastate the domestic electricity supply. [Sylvester, A. Internal paper authored for Competition Tribunal: 'Can electricity price hikes be blamed on a lack of competition in the coal markets,']
Glencore's interests clearly in the driver seat: the company shaved down $2 billion in Xstrata coal costs in 2013 by closing 33 offices and $550 million in expenses. 
http://mg.co.za/article/2013-09-27-00-jse-aquiver-over-glencore-xstrata
The competition council in more than eight countries (Japan, Brazil, Canada, China etc) were required to provide a stamp of approval. By early 2013, seven countries agreed, with European Union, China and others still deliberating. The merger has since been approved in South Africa. 
http://www.iol.co.za/business/news/eskom-retracts-glencore-xstrata-challenge-1.1455165#.Urh7efRdWPV
From 2005 to 2012, 14 large mergers and 25 overall mergers in coal industry. Biggest player is Glencore. By 2012, Glencore interests included 49.99% in Ramaphosa's Shanduka, 43.6% in Umcebo Mining; and 67% in Optimum Coal Holdings. Xstrata, similarly had major shares as well as producer role. 
Competition cases:
See: http://www.saflii.org/za/cases/ZACT/2011/56.html & http://www.comptrib.co.za/assets/Uploads/09LMFeb16.pdf
The deals appear coordinated closing: in 2011, Glencore and Ramaphosa acquired shares in Optimum Coal, the country's sixth largest coal producer for $1 bilion: the former, via Piruto B.V, a Glencore subsidiary based in Netherlands, and the latter via Lexshell 849, owned by Ramaphosa. More info can be found at:  http://www.sharedata.co.za/%5Csensad.asp?id=189431 & and media link: 
http://www.miningmx.com/page/news/markets/1205380-Watchdog-approves-Glencore-s-Optimum-deal#.Urh4JPRdWPU
Other interesting related issues, including potential monopolies on export - perceived dominance of Glencore in SA related to coal and RBCT - world's largest exporting terminal (2012)
http://www.miningmx.com/page/news/energy/1314144-Spotlight-may-fall-on-Glencores-SA-dominance#.Urh3SvRdWPU
The role of Lexshell 827 is an Special Purpose Vehicle (SPV), a typical corporate vehicle, limited to specific investment functions, used for Black Economic Empowerment (BEE) deals. Lexshell 827 has an 50.1% shareholding (majority) in Lexshell 826, as does Moxitorque Investments (Pty) Ltd. 
Competition Tribunal notes for last shareholder in SPV 826:  "Dremalo BV (“Dremalo”).... Netherlands, has a 29.441% shareholding interest in SPV.....a wholly-owned indirect subsidiary of Glencore International AG (“Glencore”). Glencore inter alia has a 34.4% shareholding interest in Xstrata Plc (“Xstrata”)1 and a 70% shareholding interest in Shanduka Coal (Pty) Ltd (“Shanduka”).
The Competition Tribunal (2011) noted, "According to the merging parties it is not clear whether or not Glencore has de facto control of Xstrata through its shareholding."
Clinton Martin Ephron and Jacobus Smith are directors is at multiple companies connected to the merger (Glencore, Umcebo etc) including Lexshell 826 and 827. 
Please see attached info from CIPRO on physical address of Lexshell 826 and 827 - 1st Floor, 23 Melrose Blvd, JHB, at Xstrata registered SA head office.

comment:
Dear Estacio
Invest in Africa Holdings Pty Ltd maintains a subsidiary, Invest in Africa Energy Pty Ltd (IIAE). Both are private entities incorporated in South Africa, with the IIAE focusing on energy across the African continent, including Mozambique via consultancy, investment etc. The company documents have been requested from CIPRO, which will take a further week. 
Shanduka, Cyril Ramaphosa's company, has facilitated a joint venture with Aggreko, a UK-based energy entity, to supply electricity from a gas-fired power plant to Eskom, South Africa's power utility as well as Electricidade de Moçambique, the Mozambican power utility. Shanduka owns 30% of this project (122 MW of interim energy from Ressano Garcia) recently awarded Africa’s Best Fast Track Power Project (2012). The company papers for Shanduka Energy have been requested from CIPRO which may take another week. The gas is derived from Sasol's Temane field.
The project is the first interim power producer (IPP) energy project supplying electricity to the Southern Africa Power Pool (SAPP) comprised on nine countries. 
Eaglestone NV (project finance/equity) is 50/50 partnered with South African company Kensani Capital, a black economic empowerment (BEE) entity, to form Kensani Eaglestone Capital Advisory Pty Ltd. The company papers will take a further week.
Eaglestone derives many reps from the Dos Santos (Luanda) regime including Pedro Coutinho. 
The interesting link between Ramaphosa and Mozambique is that Shanduka's CEO Phuti Mahanyele, is also the chair of the Gigajoule Africa Pty Ltd, a subsidiary of Gigajoule International (Pty) Limited - the company handling the $5 billion Mozambique deal, connecting Eaglestone, Shanduka etc together. The company documents for Gigajoule Africa Pty Ltd will take a further week. 
For further reading: 
Listing for Shanduka CEO: Phuti Mahanyele: http://investing.businessweek.com/research/stocks/private/person.asp?personId=30786827&privcapId=25599686&previousCapId=22103030&previousTitle=VERIMARK%20HOLDINGS%20LTD
Gigajoule website: http://www.gigajoule.co.za/home/?&re=1
 About the $5 billion project: http://www.engineeringnews.co.za/article/feasibility-study-under-way-for-5-billion-moz-based-gas-pipeline-2013-09-20
Kensani Capital's review on Eaglestone: http://www.kensanicapital.co.za/wp-content/uploads/2012/10/Eaglestone-Credentials1.pdf
Shanduka/Aggreko project: http://www.shanduka.co.za/news-releases/Shanduka-and-Aggreko-receive-Africa-Energy-Award/index.html

Lejla Camdzic

comment:
Hi Deb, 

I searched Orbis and you will see Arcadis and Fugro have about 300 subsidiaries in total. You can get records in Netherlands online (kvk.nl) but can also get a copy of all files in the registry sent to you. 

It costs 9 euro for company excerpt and 2.9 euro for each annual report. It costs more to copy all the documents. 

You can e-mail the registry here: service@wk.kvk.nl or aanvraagprofiel@wk.kvk.nl. We can buy records for you and you can reimburse us if you want. 

U should use Orbis for information purposes only because as every database it has a snapshot in time and might not be 100% up to date. Let me know if you need more help.

Best, Miranda

comment:
Let me bring you my insight about your and my ideas on Chiquita. I think we can work together, and then we’ll see if it was for the same piece.
The story of Chiquita links with AUC is the next. By 1997, Mike Gallarger and Cameron McWriter at Cinccinatti Enquirer published an investigation of the corporation, including a piece whit the transcripts of the Colombian manager trying to explain two payments to Colombian authorities for Chiquita to get a port facility in Turbo Colombia, to the answering machine of a Chiquita’s board in Cinccinatti. Gallarger and his editor were fired and the paper sued for intruding at corporate internal information and there was not development in U.S. However I followed the information on it and found that Chiquita got a complete marine operation and a duty free area licenses, denied before the first payment and granted after the second.
In September 2001, AUC was declared a terrorist organization by US State Department. In October the US Securities and Exchange Commission fined Chiquita for the illegal payments of its subsidiary (Banadex) http://www.sec.gov/litigation/admin/34-44902.htm, and next December it was reported that AUC smuggled 4.000 AKs from Nicaragua through Turbo. I realized that the only port operator at Turbo was Chiquita and exposed them. It was the beginning of the ship Otterloo case, which was investigated by a former CIA member (Robert McNamara), hired by Organization of American States, to report the roll of Nicaragua, Panamá, Guatemala, United States and Colombia at the guns shipment http://www.oas.org/OASpage/NI-COarmas/NI-COEnglish3687.htm. He said that the responsibility for the shipment entrance in Colombia was of Banadex, which he defined as a Colombian company.
When I did a series on Otterloo, showing the links of Chiquita and AUC, they tried to sue me too, but their lawyers advised not to do it, according to internal documents, released by a FOIA by National Security Archives http://www2.gwu.edu/~nsarchiv/news/20130408/.
Finally they shared the information collected to US Attorney, accepting their deals with AUC, but arguing their monthly payments (between 1997 and 2003) were done under the legitimate right to protect their people and assets. The conclusion of their 2003 release was an application to a “cease and desist action”, filed in 2005, that was finally trialed by a NY Court fining Chiquita with US$25 million.
Now Colombian victims of the AUC in the area are complaining Chiquita at US courts because its money was used to kill more than 2.000 people. But Chiquita, having the current US attorney as former lawyer, is defeating their arguments. In fact “cease and desist” actions can be granted just for one time, if not, that means that they didn’t ceased and the justice cannot desist. comment:
Defendant Faces Charges in South Florida and Southern District of New York

Wifredo A. Ferrer, United States Attorney for the Southern District of Florida, Preet Bharara, United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York, Mark R. Trouville, Special Agent in Charge, U.S. Drug Enforcement Administration (DEA), Miami Field Division, Brian Crowell, Special Agent-in-Charge, New Jersey Division of the DEA, and Janice K. Fedarcyk, Assistant Director-in-Charge, Federal Bureau of Investigation, New York Division, announce the extradition of Dolly De Jesus Cifuentes-Villa, a/k/a “La Menor,” 54, of Colombia, from Colombia to the United States to face separate charges in both the Southern District of Florida and the Southern District of New York. She is charged with conspiring to import multi-ton quantities of cocaine into the United States. Cifuentes-Villa arrived in the Southern District of New York yesterday and was immediately transferred to the Southern District of Florida, where she made her initial appearance in court yesterday before Magistrate Judge John O’Sullivan.

U.S. Attorney Wifredo A. Ferrer, of the Southern District of Florida, stated, “As this case demonstrates, the Southern District of Florida and its law enforcement partners, both at home and abroad, remain deeply committed to dismantling large international drug trafficking organizations that seek to import ton-quantities of cocaine through our borders. One by one, we will continue to bring these narco-traffickers to justice, dismantle their organizations, and seize their assets.”

U.S. Attorney Preet Bharara said: “As alleged, Dolly Cifuentas-Villa, along with her brother Jorge, was at the center of an international narco-trafficking ring that conspired to import multi ton-quantities of cocaine into the United States. Her extradition marks the first step in the process of bringing her to justice and dismantling a narcotics trafficking organization that flooded our communities with poisonous drugs. Once again, the commitment of international law enforcement to shutting these organizations down is unflagging.”

Miami DEA Special Agent in Charge Mark R. Trouville stated, “This case proves once again that we will not rest in our efforts to bring to justice any individual involved in drug trafficking anywhere in the world. The extradition of Cifuentes-Villas is a testimony of what can be accomplished in our fight against drugs, and the positive outcomes resulting from the cooperation of law enforcement authorities here in the United States and in Colombia.”

DEA Special Agent-in-Charge Brian Crowell, of the New Jersey Field Division, added, “This extradition was a standard global task force effort, using every tool in the law enforcement tool box. Cops worked together from Colombia to Ecuador and across the United States with one laser-focused goal, bringing justice to the front door step of international traffickers dead set on poisoning people in communities they never intend to set foot upon. These organizations expect their drugs and money to travel internationally, and we make sure handcuffs will travel that way as well.”

FBI Assistant Director-in-Charge Janice K. Fedarcyk, of the New York Division, noted, “Undeniably, continued effort to reduce demand is part of the solution to this country’s still significant illegal drug problem. Nonetheless, there is no question that the apprehension and extradition of someone responsible for such massive quantities of cocaine will have a major impact on the supply side of the equation. Cocaine trafficking is deadly business not only because the product itself can be lethal. It is also a brutally violent business where guns and murder are ever-present.”

Background:

The charges announced yesterday in South Florida and New York are the result of a multi-agency multi-jurisdictional investigation that began in 2006 into the activities of Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa, aka “Jota.” As a result of this investigation, Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa and members of his drug trafficking organization, including his sister Dolly De Jesus Cifuentes-Villa, were charged in the Southern District of Florida on November 4, 2010. On March 18, 2011, additional charges against Jorge and Dolly Cifuentes-Villa were unsealed in the Southern District of New York. Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa has been designated a Consolidated Priority Organization Target (CPOT), a Department of Justice designation reserved for the most dangerous and prolific narcotics traffickers. In February 2011, the U.S. Department of Treasury’s Office of Foreign Asset Control (OFAC) designated Dolly De Jesus Cifuentes-Villa and Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa as Specially Designated Narcotics Traffickers pursuant to the Foreign Narcotics Kingpin Designation Act. Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa remains at large.

The South Florida Charges:

This investigation revealed that the Cifuentes-Villa drug trafficking organization was using sophisticated drug trafficking routes to distribute multi-ton cocaine loads from Colombia through Central America, for ultimate distribution in Mexico and the United States. This investigation led to the filing of charges in the Southern District of Florida against five individuals on a myriad of federal narcotics and money laundering violations in connection with the drug trafficking organization. Among those Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa, Dolly De Jesus Cifuentes-Villa, Hildebrando Alexander Cifuentes-Villa, Joaquin Archivaldo Guzman Loera, and Otto Javier Garcia-Giron.

More specifically, Dolly De Jesus Cifuentes-Villa was charged with conspiracy to manufacture and distribute narcotics between 2003 through early 2009, knowing that such substances would be unlawfully imported into the United States, and four substantives counts of manufacturing and distributing narcotics, knowing that such substances would be unlawfully imported into the United States. The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Joan A. Lenard.

Mr. Ferrer thanked the DEA Miami Field Division and the Miami High Intensity Drug Trafficking Area (HIDTA) for their extraordinary work in this multi-agency multi-jurisdictional investigation. Mr. Ferrer also thanked the DEA Bogota Country Office, DEA Newark Field Division, and the U.S. Department of Treasury, Office of Financial Asset Control (OFAC), for their coordination and assistance in this matter. Mr. Ferrer also thanked the Colombian National Police and the U.S. Department of Justice’s Office of International Affairs for their ongoing assistance.

The New York Charges:

In the Southern District of New York, Cifuentes-Villa, is charged with one count of conspiracy to import cocaine into the United States. The case is assigned to U.S. District Judge Laura Taylor Swain.

According to the indictment previously filed in Manhattan federal court and other information obtained from public sources, from October 2008 through February 2011, Dolly Cifuentes-Villa conspired with others, including her brother and co-defendant, Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa, to import from Colombia ton-quantities of cocaine into the United States, including through Mexico. In October 2009, 8.3 tons of cocaine that Dolly Cifuentes-Villa and Jorge Milton Cifuentes-Villa were attempting to send to Mexico were seized in Ecuador.

Mr. Bharara praised the outstanding investigative work of the DEA’s New Jersey Field Division, the FBI’s New York Field Division, the DEA’s Bogota Country Office, and the DEA’s Quito Country Office. Mr. Bharara also thanked the Colombian National Police and the U.S. Department of Justice’s Office of International Affairs for their ongoing assistance. The SDNY case is being handled by that Office’s Terrorism and International Narcotics Unit. Assistant U.S. Attorneys Christian Everdell and Glen Kopp are in charge of the prosecution.

An indictment is merely an accusation and a defendant is presumed innocent unless and until proven guilty.

Return to Top

A copy of this press release may be found on the website of the United States Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida at http://www.usdoj.gov/usao/fls. Related court documents and information may be found on the website of the District Court for the Southern District of Florida at http://www.flsd.uscourts.gov or on http://pacer.flsd.uscourts.gov.

comment:
Hi Harry,

we did a preliminary research and all the records supporting it are attached.
We hold a historic data from the Montenegro stock exchange from 2008 to 2011 and I just took snapshots and put together some ownership overviews of Master Holdings (Registered on 2010-06-08) and First Financial Bank (Registered on 2007-01-22)
I'd advise you to build timelines for time periods and you'll get overlaps where the same names appear in the ownership structure.
If you need more data for some time, I can send you more files, but I tried to capture changes that occurred.
The company First Financial Securities Broker-Dealer AD (registered on 2007-01-22) was owned by the First Financial Bank AD the whole time for which we have the archives.

Benson Holdings Ltd cannot be found in Liberia's registry although I'm not sure if maybe it was dissolved long time ago and therefore they're not available any more.
Benson Holdings Ltd from Croatia was involved in wrongdoings in Bosnia with building a hydro plant and there are ties to high end crooks in Montenegro. 
But since I'm not sure this is the company we're looking for, I just attached one media report that describes the case in more detail. You can use Google translate.

I also searched for all these names in other databases and I attached an overview of possible leads. Of course I cannot identify them without an address or a DOB.

There are annual reports for the bank which you should go through thoroughly.

Miranda is an expert on Montenegro and especially on financial records. If you want to, you can share more details with her and maybe you could work on this research together. In that case we could go on a more in-depth search for meaning of all the records.

Looking forward to your response and the results of course. 

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Dear Lawrence,

we were able to confirm that the company Wilderness Safaris Ltd exists in Bermuda. It was incorporated on 5-Apr-1995.
If you really need original records, some information might be obtained from their registry. Registry of directors could be available but the registry normally does not keep information on shareholders. I don't know about annual reports, but it's not highly likely we will get them.
These records can be quite costly (40+ dollars) and it takes minimum 3 weeks to get them. In case you still want us to try to get the original records, your organization need to cover the costs?

Results from Orbis (a high-quality global database) shows that Wilderness Safaris Ltd (BM) is owned by Wilderness Holdings Ltd (BW) along with 47 other subsidiaries.

Wilderness Safaris Ltd (BW) is owned by:

Wine Investments Ltd (GB) - 25,92%
Puma SE (DE) - 25,10%
Kering (FR) - 5%
Capital Africa Ltd (ZA) - (percentage not available)

Wine Investments Ltd (GB) is owned and managed by:
- Allan Struthers Wilson - 50%
- Alexandra Patricia Wilson - 50%

If you don't have one, I advise you to open an account on www.duedil.com and you can research this company and the Wilsons more there.
If you want original records and annual reports which will tell you the most about a company, all the links you need are in the "Business Registries" section of ID.

Puma SE is the company that owns the big sports equipment and clothing brand - Puma and is owned by Famille Pinault

Kering is a French company also owned by Famille Pinault (www.kering.com)

Capital Africa Ltd is a fund. Further research would be needed to determine what kind of fond.

Now, that's what the ownership structure is about. Yes this company exist in an offshore jurisdiction but keep in mind that it's not illegal and that a lot of the world's largest corporations keep their money in offshores. It's really not uncommon. Now proving that as you said it "owns several other companies and it is central to all the corruption in this country" is going to need a lot of other proofs.

The first link from the ID that you sent means that the term you searched for was found in the Official Gazette of Luxembourg. If you searched for the same thing on the official site of the gazette you wouldn't get anything because it only searches through company names, not through the entire content of the publications.

In this case Wilderness Safaris Ltd (BM) was represented (by Russel Friedman, Colin Bell and/or Andy Payneat) a general board meeting of the company Norisco Holdings S.A. (LU) on 10-Nov-1999 and 19-Jul-2008.
The second link you sent means that there is a company registered in Panama called Masire Overseas, incorporated on 3-Dec-2010.
Its directors are:
Ida A. de Rodriguez
Carlos Bryden
Isolda Moran Anira

Its subscribers are:
Ida Lides Arjona de Rodriguez
Carlos Armando Bryden Gonzalez

All of them are also subscribers and directors in dozens of other companies which means they are highly likely to be proxies for someone else.
Sir Masire did not appear in any other companies in the general databases.

If you need an in-depth research of individuals you would need to file a separate request with their exact names and spelling variations, dates of birth, addresses, family members and closest associates.

This is all I have for you for now. Please take a look at it and if you need additional information about these people and companies, please file them in separate requests, it will be easier for both of us to keep track of the information. 

Best,

Lejla Camdzic
ID researcher

Best, Miranda

comment:
Hello Giovanni,

you can find all the registries (by state) in the US on our website if you go to the Business Registries section (in the upper left hand corner).
Delaware is considered an offshore (even though it's not actually off shore). There are some agents that can offer you information about companies there and it can get somewhat expensive. But even that does not guarantee that you will reach the final beneficial owner because the companies are often run by proxies, lawyers etc.

If you have a specific company you're looking for you can file a separate request here with more specifics.

Best,

Lejla Camdzic
ID researcher

comment:
Hello Kristi,

company Marano Besitz- & Verwaltungs AG form Switzerland has been in liquidation process since 2011.
I'm also sending you attached a profile from the database Lexis/Nexis which shows this company's basic information.
You'll notice there that this company has issued bearer shares.
This means that the owner of the company is the person who holds the share certificate.
These shares are not registered with any authority and transferring the ownership involves only delivering the physical document.

I also attached all the notices from the official gazette and in one of them can find that only the information that the shareholders' meeting took place will be published in the gazette but the information about the place and time will be delivered to shareholder in a letter.

Valerii Medzhlumyan, with this name spelling and some other variations I tried, unfortunately did not appear in any of the global databases we have access to.

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Hi,
thank you, I found it now. Files are attached.
Reciplia is owned by:
Doorbell Trading Ltd (Cyprus) - 7,8%
Riverside Realestate Corp. (BVI) - 87,8%
STG Ventures Ltd (BVI) - 4,4%

I also got you the records for the Doorbell Trading Ltd. 
Unfortunately that's a dead end. It's owned by some Cyprus lawyers who serve as proxies.

STG Ventures Ltd - I'm sending you search results from the BVI registry. This was the only thing available. We bought it a while ago for some other research. It just shows address, registered agent, incorporation date etc.

However, check out the previous owners of the Reciplia. There's Remus Truica.
He also owns companies BRG Residencial Consulting Services and until recently Riverside Realestate Corp. owned 50% in this company.
Truica is also listed as administrator in Solaro Green Energy SRL and this company is owned by Solaro Development Ltd from China.

Bajenariu did not appear anywhere.

I sent you profiles from the database Orbis for this. Please do not publish these profiles. These are not company records, they get the information from their service providers for each country.

I don't have any records for Riverside Realestate Corp. because we only get BVI records if there's really a strong story and we really need to take that final step. That's because it's really expensive to get them, it takes a week or two and they really rarely show just directors.
However, if you want to file this request and check Riverside Realestate Corp. we can do it and you can reimburse us for the cost.
Search only (like the document for SGT) costs $25 and all the other records are paid $1 per page and some additional costs per the document and bank fees.

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Dear Erik,

You are right, the overview document from the registry of Panama was not attached here, but you could see it in the Data Vault.
This document [Registry_Investors Trading Company S.A. - Panama] shows that Investors Trading Company S.A. is originally from Venezuela. 
Please go over these documents carefully, I attached another document [2000-11-20 - Investors Trading Company - Change of Location]. There I circled in red the important part where it says that the only shareholder of this company is Expibel Investments AG.
This company is registered in Switzerland and it changed its name to Investor Growth Capital AG.
For this Swiss company I attached overview from moneyhouse.ch. This website offers a lot of information about Swiss companies for free, so you can open an account there yourself and check for more details.

I also attached profiles from a global database Orbis which shows that the ultimate owner of Investor Growth Capital AG is Swedish company Investor AG. I'm also sending you their profile but please do not publish these Orbis profiles. They also include all search results for all the companies where Wallenberg and Ekholm appeared.

At the moment, I cannot tell if Wallenberg and Ekholm were directors of the Panamanian company in years 1998-2000. The overview you see in the document [Registry_Investors Trading Company S.A. - Panama] was active on the last day when the company existed in Panama.

This is as far as we can go with our work online. We've provided you with all the records available leading all the way to Sweden. At this point it would take actual field work of a researcher in Panama and if you are willing to cover their fee per hour of work, they could go to the registry and try to recover more documents.

Our researchers cannot do the reporting part of the business for journalists. You can contact companies, do interviews and so on and please feel free to file new requests if you need specific documents.
Wish you the best of luck.

Lejla Camdzic
Researcher

comment:
Hello Alejandro,

I'm sending you all I could find on the company Universal En Linea Inc (Florida) as the document you attached shows that they are the owners of the registered fictitious name "royalvacationresorts.com"
I see you've already searched the official registry in Florida. There can be plenty of records available for free, like Annual reports, but unfortunately some companies file them empty.
UCC filings are the most valuable report you could get, but unfortunately those are not available for this company either.
I'm also sending you all the court cases I could find that involve this company. Please go over all of those, maybe they will reveal something interesting for you. They're all from a county court, I couldn't find any cases on higher level courts.

I'm also sending you profiles and search results from Orbis and Lexis/Nexis, which are general databases (and we ask all the reporters not to publish these, so please don't, rather try to confirm the data with the original company records).
However, some information in it is very interesting:
- Lexis profile shows that Universal En Linea Inc. has been active since 2006, not only from 2011 when this company was registered. It might be possible that another company was the owner of the fictitious name.
- Orbis shows other companies in Miami that have the same director (Amaury Martinez) and all of them are in the same business.
So I'd advise you to do the same thing I did - look for all these companies and all the records available in the Florida official companies registry and the Miami-Dade county court for possible existing court cases. Links for these are available in the "Business Registries" section of our website.
They are important because they can reveal instances when Soledad or Amaury Martinez appeared in court as a party and in fact it was their company that was being sued.
I attached a bunch of them but I suggest you search for cases as you reveal new company names.

In case you need some more information when you find new companies and names, please feel free to file a new request.

Best,

Lejla Camdzic

comment:
Hola, muy buenas tardes. ¿Cómo estas?
Hay algunos informes sobre la pobreza en Honduras que tal vez puedan serte útiles. ¿Puedes decirnos sobre qué exactamente necesitas datos? ¿Es una investigación financiera, para sociedad o que relaciona pobreza y delito, por ejemplo? Si puedes darnos más detalles seguramente te orientaremos mejor.

Mientras tanto, te sugiero mirar uno reciente donde el Banco Mundial se pregunta por qué persiste la pobreza en el país: "La pobreza en Honduras apenas ha cambiado desde 1998, a pesar del crecimiento económico positivo de alrededor de 3 por ciento anual en términos reales. Si bien el PIB per cápita se ha mantenido estancado en 0.3 por ciento anual, esto explica sólo parcialmente la falta de progreso en los indicadores de pobreza. Entonces, ¿por qué se ha mantenido tan persistente la pobreza en Honduras y qué pueden hacer los encargados de políticas para elevar los niveles de vida? El continuo progreso en la reducción de la pobreza y en el crecimiento es un proyecto a largo plazo y no existen soluciones rápidas. Sin embargo, como lo señala el análisis de este informe, existen políticas que podrían implementarse en los próximos años, que tendrían beneficios a corto y a largo plazo".
A la izquierda de esta página puedes clicear en 'Volumen 1' y 'Volumen 2' para acceder al informe: http://web.worldbank.org/WBSITE/EXTERNAL/BANCOMUNDIAL/EXTSPPAISES/LACINSPANISHEXT/EXTLACREGTOPPOVANAINSPA/0,,contentMDK:20999934~pagePK:34004173~piPK:34003707~theSitePK:792203,00.html

Luego el informe de Naciones Unidas de 2013 analizó el índice de desarrollo humano y colocó a Honduras en el puesto 120. PNUD considera a Honduras como un país de desarrollo humano 'medio' ('bajo' es a partir del puesto 142). El cuadro con la totalidad de los países puede verse en las páginas 149, 150 y 151 de este documento: http://www.pnud.org.ec/Noticias2013/HDR2013%20Report%20Spanish.pdf. En este informe, hay más cuadros con información disponible sobre, por ejemplo, manejos de los recursos, empleo, investigación y desarrollo y logros en educación. 

Quedamos pendientes de tu respuesta para darte otros datos.
Saludos!
author: ah5zfmludmVzdGlnYXRpdmUtZGFzaGJvYXJkLXByb2RyEwsSC1VzZXJQcm9maWxlGOrHPgw

The company Guinea Lanka Corporation as well as Lasantha Atthanayake are both of equal interest. So ideally we would like to find out more about company ownership but also what other companies Mr. Atthanayake is involved with, especially if it relates to fisheries, shipping or mining activities. 
We know that the company is protected by people in the government and local law enforcement. 

We are about to travel to Guinea and if we cannot get this information quickly it may not be of much use to us. Anything longer than two weeks would probably be too later so please let us know if that timeframe is not possible. 

Sooner would be so much better. Sorry for the tight deadline

comment:
Hi,

Unfortunately Seychelles is one of the jurisdictions where almost nothing is available, and what is available (i.e. certificate of incorporation) costs $100, which is too much for us to pay. 

You best bet is Hungarian registry or any authority this company has dealt with. You should try to get all paper records, because companies, when they register companies in other countries have to file records about themselves with local registry. You should try to get access to company file and look for information about proxies or any other records that Seychelles company has filed. 

Good luck!

Miranda
author: ah5zfmludmVzdGlnYXRpdmUtZGFzaGJvYXJkLXByb2RyFAsSC1VzZXJQcm9maWxlGPn4mwEM

comment:
Hi! I can´t attach files at ID now. Because of that, I´m sending general information. Could you please send me your email? I´ll attach documents on an email. 
Up to now, I have all this information (but I´ll continue the research).

General Information:
Manuka bought in 2008 22,5 thousand ha of the Nuble-Rupanco.
Chilean authorities reportedly launching an investigation into alleged animal cruelty by Manuka Dairy. Reports in the Chilean and New Zealand press have accused Manuka’s operation in the country of killing “thousands” of calves not needed in the milk processing process by “leaving them starving, slitting their throats or beating them with objects of great forcefulness”.

Manuka asked public apology for killing of thousands of calves: http://www.aproleche.cl/noticias/includes/muestra_noticias_anteriores.php?idi=3637

Manuka SA provide to small farmers in the region of Los Lagos 3000 male calves (one of the measures taken by the dairy in part to appease the questions received after he left to light the killing of more than 7000 male calves): http://www.biobiochile.cl/2014/02/22/empresa-lactea-manuka-entregara-sin-costo-3-mil-terneros-a-pequenos-agricultores-de-los-lagos.shtml

Attorneys:
Silva & Cia acted as attorneys of Manuka at brand register (document attach) at december 2013.

Documents:
D 1: "Escritura pública Manuka". Enroll a new society in the public register of Santiago de Chile. Called Laurensons SA. Object: development of productive activities.
D 2: Gazette (Chile´s official bulletin). Manuka apply for right to use groundwater (december 2013).
D 3: one academic document about New Zealand farming systems in South America.
D 4: The Environmental Impact Statement Project "Fundo Puchaura Drainage" by the Lord MANUKA SA MANUKA SA MANUKA Inc., dated December 12, 2005.
Reply of Regional Environmental Commission, March 2009.
D 5: photos and description of the place and work at Manuka (friendly with the company but you can find general information and may be something interiesting): Manuka has 7000ha in milk production. Around 17,500 cows are milked through 35 dairies in herds of 600 producing 79 million litres of milk last year. Manuka has 350 employees. A quarter of its milk is produced by sharemilkers. It’s already the largest grass based milk producer in Chile, supplying four dairy companies including Soprole. Zachery informed me that the company is well on target to milk 43,000 cows by 2019. (Page 16 and 17).
D 6: Power Point wrtting by Juan Carlos Petersen W., Gerente General Manuka S.A. About 'milk in the wordl and in Chile'.
This is all that we found of Manuka, up to now. Let me now if it helps and if you need more data.

What you are looking for Rimu SA?

comment:
Hello, here is some general information about Tasiga Corp. Let me know if you need more specific information (what kind of information do you need?). 
About the owners: the names of the shareholders of the companies registered in Panama (real owners of the company) is reserved information (lack of information about the owners). The Law 32 of February 26th, 1927 grants confidentiality to assets, identity, business and banking transactions.  In addition, Panamanian Sociedad Anonima does not permit the piercing of the corporate veil.  This regulation allows the Sociedad Anonima’s corporate books to be maintained completely private and confidential to any outsider. Piercing the corporate veil in Panama is considered an extraordinary remedy; the only way this remedy can be exercised is in cases of fraud or public violation.
Anyway, we have some public information of Tasiga Corp.: 
1) Name of executor: ALEX ALBERTO SANCHEZ, MARIBEL RAMIREZ
2) Legal representative:  SHIRLEY & ASOCIADOS
3) Purpose of the company: "The business that this corporation shall initiate, engage, develop and carry out whithin and outside the Rpublic of Panama, shall be the following: a) to invest capital in others corporations (...). 
4) Social capital: The autorised capital of the corporation is the sum of 10,000 dolars, one hundred common nominative or bearer shares with a nominal value of one hundred dollars each.
5) Adress:  The domicilie is in ity of Panama, but the corporation may engage in business conduct in activities and establish its offices, places of business and branches in any other place in the Republic of Panama and in any other country of place in the word. 
6) Duration of the company: The duration shall be perpetual but the corpotarion may be dissolved at any time by a decision of the mayority of of the stockholders. 
7) Boars of Directors: 
VIDOLI, CLAUDIO (president)
CAPRANI, UMBERTO (secretary)
BINDA, EMILIO

comment:
Buna, Liviu,

Nu am gasit legaturi directe intre cei doi si firmele Hellenik Plastic si Personal Care. Voi incerca sa caut direct in registrul grec dar mai dureaza putin. 

Am scos listele cu firmele in care apar Barla si Kotteakos din bazele de date Mint Global si Orbis, le gasesti atasate (listele + datele despre companii).

Acestia doi nu apar nici in Lexus Enterprises, am cautat in registrul oficial din UK. Atasat ai lista cu cei care apar in firma in prezent si in istoricul ei. Poti verifica daca vreunul dintre ei apare in documentele Hellenik Plastic sau Personal Care. La prima vedere, nu par sa apara. Am scos si McCann Erikson Advertising din Mint Global.

Posibil ca functiile celor doi sa nu apara in documentele oficiale, depinde ce posturi ocupa.

Cand fac rost de documentele originale din registrul grec, le uploadez aici.

Sa-mi spui daca mai pot face ceva intre timp.

Numai bine,
Laura

comment:
Hello, 

as a response to your request, I've downloaded and attached here files downloaded from the Official Companies Registry of Cyprus.
I named them by dates to show you a chronological overview of the changes in the company.

Currently Denis Katsyv (a Russian national, with an address in Moscow) owns 99,9 percent and Martash Investment Holdings Ltd (a BVI company) owns 0,1 percent.

Current director is Timofey Krit (also a Russian national with an address in Moscow). The company also listed as director is just an incorporation agent or a lawyer service from Cyprus.

Please also pay attention to the previous directors and shareholders.

What also might interest you is that I've searched general worldwide databases, and I found that Prevezon Holdings Ltd (Cyprus) is registered as a foreign company's office in New York, Kings County, United States. 
I'm sending you a short overview from the New York State Division of Corporations. 

It might also be of interest to you that a company called Prevezon Berlin GmbH is registered in Germany (you'll see this in the Lexis files)

Please take a look at these files and let me know if these are useful leads for you.

Best,

Lejla Camdzic

comment:
jhkjh

Hi Kristi,

I've attached records from the Official Gazette of Luxembourg. This is the only place where companies file the changes. They don't list financial results but I believe that all the other changes are listed.
When you open files from the gazette just search for the company name (the pages cannot be extracted so you'll see the whole issues).

The last issue from February this year seems to say that their holding company is from Gibraltar. Records from Gibraltar can be obtained but they cost 40 Pounds and have to be delivered by post so it takes about 4 weeks to get them.

When you go over all the changes let me know if there's more I can do to help.
Please file separate requests if you find some people that you want searched (for most of them you'll find both DOB and an address).

And of course, if you're interested in the records from Gibraltar, just let me know. However, we'd have to ask you to cover the cost of getting them as they are rather expensive. But if you're doing a story for OCCRP, than we'll cover the cost of records (if you and your editors decide they are essential). 

I hope this helped.

Best,

Lejla

comment:
Hola Rubén, ¿cómo estás? Te paso lo que hemos encontrado hasta el momento para que puedas ir viendo y quedo pendiente por si necesitas ampliar o profundizar algo. 
Hay informes de organismos internacionales y nacionales que señalan que la violencia es, en definitiva, un fenómeno multicausal relacionado con la pobreza y con otras manifestaciones como desialdad, narcotráfico, postergación comunitaria. 

El Informe de Desarrollo Humano del PNUD 2013 marca los grados de violencia en Honduras y su relación con el Índice de Desarrollo Humano: En los últimos años, el índice promedio  mundial de homicidios en 189 países con datos disponibles fue de 6,9 por cada 100.000  personas,57 con un mínimo de cero en Mónaco y un máximo de 91,6 en Honduras (véase cuadro estadístico 9). Existe una correlación negativa relativamente baja entre los índices de homicidio y los valores del IDH; en los países con IDH bajo es de 14,6 por cada 100.000 personas, en aquellos con IDH alto es de 13,0 y en los países con IDH muy alto, de 2,1. Los índices de homicidio son más altos en América Latina y el Caribe (22,2 por cada 100.000 personas), seguidos por África Subsahariana (20,4), Europa y Asia Central (5,5), los Estados Árabes (4,5), Asia Meridional (3,7) y Asia Oriental y el Pacífico (2,8).
El anterior es un párrafo copiado textual de aquí: http://www.pnud.org.ec/Noticias2013/HDR2013%20Report%20Spanish.pdf

El Banco Interamericano de Desarrollo señalaba en 2002 que "una de las explicaciones más comúnmente aceptadas sobre la violencia en Honduras es la relacionada con la pobreza, la exclusión y la falta de oportunidades como circunstancias que conducen al ejercicio de la violencia. Se pueden transcribir distintas 
versiones de esta familia de explicaciones. De acuerdo con una encuesta realizada recientemente entre 254 informantes claves “el principal problema en materia de seguridad se asocia en opinión de un 33% de los 
encuestados con la “miseria extrema”. “Se consideran entre otros como los principales elementos explicativos (de la  violencia) los siguientes: 
• el deterioro de la calidad de vida como resultado de la aplicación de medidas de ajuste económico 
• Pobreza y extrema pobreza, marginalidad y exclusión que acentúan la desigualdad e iniquidad social 
• Desempleo, subempleo, falta de oportunidades y bajos salarios 
• Déficit de vivienda”.
(ESTO CITADO TEXTUAL DE LA PÁGINA 14 DEL INFORME 'LA VIOLENCIA EN HONDURAS' QUE ADJUNTO). 
En las páginas 15 y 16 señala algunas dificultades para el análisis de la relación pobreza-violencia:
1) Desde el punto de vista de los agresores contra la propiedad se cuenta en Honduras con alguna información parcial: características sobre la población reclusa. Ahí marca que sólo una baja proporción de los delitos cometidos conducen a la detención de los infractores y que la población de escasos recursos está sobre representada en las cárceles por ser aquella que no cuenta con la posibilidad de contratar abogados para su defensa.
2) La información sobre los agresores de homicidio es muy limitada.
En la página 18 apunta:
Lo que se ha encontrado en algunos ejercicios sobre determinantes de la violencia a partir de comparaciones internacionales es que si bien los indicadores de pobreza no contribuyen a la explicación de las diferencias en las tasas de homicidio, los indicadores de desigualdad si lo hacen.


En un informe que adjunto, Social Watch señala que la violencia impide el desarrollo en Honduras y, por ende, marca la estrecha relación entre pobreza-violencia. La tesis es, de todas maneras, que la violencia impide el desarrollo (o sea: bajar los niveles de pobreza). Entre las caudad del crecimiento de los niveles de violencia, señala el golpe de 2009. 
Cito textual algunos pasajes: 
"El principal obstáculo para que el país alcance un desarrollo sustentable es la violencia que impera en casi cada capa de su estructura social, tanto urbana como rural". 
"Según un informe de la PNUD, en el conjunto de países centroamericanos la tasa de asesinatos es de 44 por cada 100.000 habitantes, 11 veces el promedio mundial de cuatro por cada 100.000. En 2010, la tasa de asesinatos en Honduras fue de 77,5 cada 100.000 habitantes. Según la Organización Mundial de la Salud, la tasa considerada normal es de nueve homicidios cada 100.000 personas, pudiendo considerarse epidemia a partir de los 10".  
"La violencia, endémica en el país, se ha visto exacerbada tras el golpe de Estado de junio de 2009".
"En enero de 2010 una comisión gubernamental produjo un extenso documento destinado al Congreso Nacional, titulado Visión de País 2010-2038 y Plan de Nación 2010-2022. En el mismo se identifican varios puntos problemáticos de cara a la búsqueda de un futuro de desarrollo sustentable. Los altos valores de la pobreza extrema, los bajos rendimientos escolares, el desempleo y la informalidad, la alta vulnerabilidad a las catástrofes naturales, son algunos de los elementos que necesitarían vigorosas políticas a largo plazo para ser corregidos". 
"Antes del golpe de Estado de 2009, Honduras pasaba por un lento proceso de reducción de la pobreza, la cual afectaba en 2005 a 63,7% de los hogares y en mayo de 2009, a 58,8%". 

En otro informe adjunto de 2011, el Banco Mundial avala la misma hipótesis: la violencia atenta contra e desarrollo de Latinoamérica. 

El Banco Mundial señala a Honduras como un país de ingreso medio-bajo que se enfrenta a desafíos significativos, con más de dos tercios de la población del país viviendo en pobreza y cerca del 46% en extrema pobreza (2012). En zonas rurales un 58% de los hogares están en extrema pobreza. Pero, dice el BM, los altos niveles de crimen y violencia son el mayor desafío para el desarrollo de Honduras, al ser el país con la mayor tasa de homicidios en el mundo. Entre 2005 y 2011, las tasas de homicidio en Honduras se incrementaron de 37 a 91.6 homicidios por cada 100,000 habitantes. La mayoría de la violencia está concentrada en áreas urbanas (65% de los homicidios ocurren en 5% de las municipalidades) y la mayoría de víctimas de homicidios son hombres (94%), particularmente los comprendidos entre los 15 y 34 años de edad (63%). 
Y estima que los costos anuales de la violencia representan alrededor del 10% del PIB del país (cerca de US$900 millones). El crimen y la violencia también han erosionado la confianza de los ciudadanos en el imperio de la ley. En Honduras, en comparación con personas que no han sufrido crimen alguno, las víctimas de crímenes son 6.5% más propensos a tomar justicia por propia mano y son 9% menos propensos a creer que el Estado de Derecho siempre debe ser respetado.
